CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1940 reads: "Hampton Boys And Girls Have A Holiday While Big-Wigs Stage Defense Conference - Books, except for the few who might have been behind in their studies were forgotten by Hampton's students last week during the two days consumed by the Conference On Participation of Negroes in National Defense. Some of those who had a rather gay time following the proceedings are shown above.  Left: Miss Roberta Russell, Lieut. Whittier L. Johnson and Miss Helen Strickland.  Top center: Capt. Frank Brower, the Beech-Nut representative, surrounded by beauties, left to right, Vera Lewis, D. Charmaine Jeffries, Hattie Davis,  Louise Pettaway, Loia Ingraham and Cordelia Kidd.  On either end are the guards, Leo Robinson and "Papa" Yoken.  Bottom center Irene Robinson, of White Plains, N.Y., and Milwood Mateley, of Danville, Va.  Right, Margaret Mann, a budding Dorothy Maynor chosen as Hampton's Homecoming Queen. - Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Roberta Russell, Lieut. Whittier L. Johnson, and Helen Strickland standing on lawn at Hampton Institute with large building with domed top in background
